page.title: 04POLICE REPORT (LITTLE HULTON
page.content: A{police officer}is a citizen, locally appointed with authority from the crown to carry out his/her duty including the{protection of life and {property,}the maintainance of order, prevention & detection of crime and the{prosecution}of offenders against the peace. During{training}a new recruit will learn about law, courts, reporting procedure, how to arrest, self defence and life saving. Common local{crimes include house breaking, robbery from factories and warehouses, shop lifting, car theft, vandalism and mugging. Should a police officer discover a break in they must always radio back to base for back-up assistance. They never tackle the situation alone. The use of {bobbies {on the beat} is encouraged as it helps to foster good community relations.
